title: How to Use Power Armor in Fallout 76

steps.headline: Find a Power Armor frame out in the Appalachian Wasteland.
steps.description: Easier said than done, right? Well don't worry, there are actually spots you can frequent for Power Armor, such as the Morgantown Train Yard, Black Bear Lodge, Camp Venture, and Aaronholdt Homestead. Power Armor also spawns near certain Brotherhood of Steel camps, and other random areas out in the wasteland.

steps.headline: Loot the Power Armor frame.
steps.description: For new players, chances are you cannot simply enter the Power Armor as is. Power Armor pieces unlock at different levels, so while you can enter any empty Power Armor frame, you cannot use Power Armor pieces unless you meet their required level.

steps.headline: Make sure a Fusion Core is inside the Power Armor frame, and insert one if there is not.
steps.description: Like with Fallout 4, Power Armor relies on Fusion Cores to run. These can be found in generators or in ammunition crates out in the Appalachian Wasteland.

steps.headline: Enter the Power Armor frame.
steps.description: Walk or fast travel to your C.A.M.P. where you can safely store it. Alternatively, you can enter the Power Armor frame to claim it as yours, exit it, then pick it up as an item in your inventory.

steps.headline: Continue leveling up as you progress in the game.
steps.description: Check back every now and then to see if you meet the level you need to wear Power Armor pieces.

steps.headline: Collect scrap and supplies from your adventures in the wasteland.
steps.description: Similar to Fallout 4, you need scavenged materials to repair your Power Armor pieces.

steps.headline: Add the Power Armor pieces to your Power Armor frame as you unlock them.
steps.description: Once you have a full suit of Power Armor, drop it from your inventory.

steps.headline: Enter the Power Armor frame.
steps.description: Revel in your glory, as you are now a juggernaut of the Appalachian Wasteland.

text: Find a Power Armor frame out in the Appalachian Wasteland. Easier said than done, right? Well don't worry, there are actually spots you can frequent for Power Armor, such as the Morgantown Train Yard, Black Bear Lodge, Camp Venture, and Aaronholdt Homestead. Power Armor also spawns near certain Brotherhood of Steel camps, and other random areas out in the wasteland. Loot the Power Armor frame. For new players, chances are you cannot simply enter the Power Armor as is. Power Armor pieces unlock at different levels, so while you can enter any empty Power Armor frame, you cannot use Power Armor pieces unless you meet their required level. Make sure a Fusion Core is inside the Power Armor frame, and insert one if there is not. Like with Fallout 4, Power Armor relies on Fusion Cores to run. These can be found in generators or in ammunition crates out in the Appalachian Wasteland. Enter the Power Armor frame. Walk or fast travel to your C.A.M.P. where you can safely store it. Alternatively, you can enter the Power Armor frame to claim it as yours, exit it, then pick it up as an item in your inventory. Continue leveling up as you progress in the game. Check back every now and then to see if you meet the level you need to wear Power Armor pieces. Collect scrap and supplies from your adventures in the wasteland. Similar to Fallout 4, you need scavenged materials to repair your Power Armor pieces. Add the Power Armor pieces to your Power Armor frame as you unlock them. Once you have a full suit of Power Armor, drop it from your inventory. Enter the Power Armor frame. Revel in your glory, as you are now a juggernaut of the Appalachian Wasteland.
